Description: Postcard; printed paper; shows the lighthouse at Alexandria.
Curator's comments: Old card; very good condition; postally unused but with the concluding part of a message from one Fred, the first part being on one or more other cards which must have been sent in an envelope (now missing). The message on this card reads: "unless there is a m'sieur [i.e. monsieur] to object. Many thanks for promise of photo. I want to see if you are like "the Organ Girl". Very sorry to hear you will be unable to go to Scarboro[ugh], our next port of call is Jaffa. An excursion is being run to Jerusalem. But I have already been so I shall not take advantage of it this time. Will try & get some PCs of there however." The content of the message suggests the sender may be on military service and this would be consistent with a date of about 1920, although the card itself is slightly earlier. The closing reference to getting some postcards of a place the sender isn't even going to is an interesting piece of social history and also testimony to the power of Jerusalem.
